intro: Cusparia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited cusparia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its robust, branched stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its fruits are dry, three-lobed capsules that contain several seeds. Native to South America, it thrives in temperate climates and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides.
